2:
Surely there are mockers with me;
\q my eye must always see their provocation.
\m
\q
3:
Give now a pledge, be a guarantee for me with yourself;
\q who else is there who will help me?
5:
He who denounces his friends for a reward,
\q the eyes of his children will fail.
\m
8:
Upright men will be stunned by this;
\q the innocent man will stir himself up against godless men.
10:
But as for you all, come on now;
\q I will not find a wise man among you.
11:
My days are past; my plans are over.
\q As for the wishes of my heart ... 
\f + \ft Some modern versions have \fqa My days are past, as are my plans. The wishes of my heart are finished \fqb or \fqa ... the strings of my heart have been broken \fqb . Others have \fqa My days are past; my plans are over, as are the wishes of my heart \fqb \f*
\q
12:
These people, these mockers, change the night into day;
\q light is near to darkness.
14:
since I have said to the pit, 'You are my father,'
\q and to the worm, 'You are my mother or my sister,'
\q
15:
where then is my hope?
\q As for my hope, who can see any?
16:
Will hope go down with me to the gates of Sheol
\q when we descend to the dust?"
